meanings.sent1: The old building on the corner was known as the cathouse in town.
meanings.sent2: The police raided the cathouse last night and arrested several people.
meanings.sent3: The cathouse had a sign that said 'Meow-ssage parlor' as a joke.
meanings.sent4: She jokingly called her friend's place a cathouse because of all the visitors.
meanings.sent5: The neon lights of the cathouse glowed in the dark, attracting curious onlookers.

meanings.definition: A house or shelter for cats.
meanings.sent1: The cathouse in the backyard had cozy beds for all the stray cats.
meanings.sent2: She volunteers at the local cathouse, helping feed and care for the feline residents.
meanings.sent3: The cathouse was painted in bright colors to make it more appealing to the cats.
meanings.sent4: The cathouse resembled a miniature palace for the pampered felines.
meanings.sent5: The cathouse had scratching posts and toys to keep the cats entertained.
